docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's governors don't want people in their states to lose health coverage under a repeal of the Obama-era health care law, but even after a weekend of bipartisan meetings, they still don't agree on the best approach to replace it.

headline.main: Plan to Repeal Obama Health Law Shows GOP Governors Are Torn
headline.print_headline: Plan to Repeal Obama Health Law Shows GOP Governors Are Torn

docs.lead_paragraph: For Barack Obama, there's a presidential library to build, hundreds of millions of dollars to raise, causes to champion and a book to write. And don't forget that long-promised vacation with his wife.

docs.lead_paragraph: A trade association representing General Motors Co, Toyota Motor Corp, Volkswagen AG and nine other automakers on Tuesday asked new Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt to withdraw an Obama administration decision to lock in vehicle emission rules through 2025.

docs.lead_paragraph: New Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke plans to review Obama-era measures that limited energy development on some federal land and undertake a "bold" reorganization of his 70,000-employee agency, he said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is marking the first anniversary of the Iran nuclear deal by warning the Trump administration that the accord can't easily be undone and is preferable to war.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration will begin rolling back Obama-era environmental regulations in an "aggressive way" as soon as next week, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency said on Saturday - adding he understood why some Americans want to see his agency eliminated completely.

headline.main: Aggressive Cuts to Obama-Era Green Rules to Start Soon: EPA Head

docs.lead_paragraph: Kenyan artist Evans Yegon is sad to see President Barack Obama leave office. The artist has made a name for himself painting $1,000 portraits of Obama and he's finding the new focus of his work — Donald Trump — a hard sell.

headline.main: Obama Made Kenyan Artist's Name, but Trump Portraits Fizzle

docs.lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the new secretary general, António Guterres, said that a phone call between the two men “went quite well,” though he did not elaborate on what they spoke about.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 22 about a U.S. registration system for Muslim immigrants, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Kansas Secretary of State Kris Kobach met President-elect Donald Trump in New York last month. Kobach and Trump met in Bedminster, N.J.
